Name: Cyber Security Governance - Committee Establishment
Description: A cyber security committee should be established and be mandated by the board.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Top Management Leading the Committee
Description: The cyber security committee should be headed by an independent senior manager from a control function.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Senior Management Representation
Description: The senior managers from all relevant departments (e.g., COO, CIO, compliance officer, heads of relevant business departments) should be represented in the cyber security committee:

Name: Cyber Security Governance - CISO
Description: The Chief information security officer (CISO) should be represented in the cyber security committee:

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Internal Audit Team
Description: The Internal audit may attend the cyber security committee as an observer.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Committee Objectives
Description: A cyber security committee charter should be developed, approved and reflect including committee objectives.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Committee Roles & Responsibilities
Description: A cyber security committee charter should be developed, approved and reflect including roles and responsibilities.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Committee Number of Meeting Participants
Description: A cyber security committee charter should be developed, approved and reflect including minimum number of meeting participants.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Committee Meeting Frequency
Description: A cyber security committee charter should be developed, approved and reflect including meeting frequency (minimum on quarterly basis).

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Establish a Cybersecurity Function
Description: A cyber security function should be established.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - An Independent Cybersecurity Function
Description: The cyber security function should be independent from the information technology function. To avoid any conflict of interest, the cyber security function and information technology function should have separate reporting lines, budgets and staff evaluations.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Cybersecurity Function Reporting Line
Description: The cyber security function should report directly to the CEO/managing director of the Member Organization or general manager of a control function.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Appointing a senior manager
Description: A full-time senior manager for the cyber security function, referred to as CISO, should be appointed at senior management level.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Saudi National CISO
Description: The Member Organization should ensure the CISO has a Saudi nationality.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Qualified CISO
Description: The Member Organization should ensure the CISO is sufficiently qualified.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - No Objection from SAMA
Description: The Member Organization should obtain no objection from SAMA to assign the CISO.

Name: Cyber Security Governance - Allocation of Budget
Description: The board of the Member Organization should allocate sufficient budget to execute the required cyber security activities.

Name: Cyber Security Strategy - Approval & execution
Description: The cyber security strategy should be defined, approved, maintained and executed.

Name: Cyber Security Strategy - Alignment with objectives
Description: The cyber security strategy should be aligned with the Member Organizations overall objectives.

Name: Cyber Security Strategy - Alignment with laws/regulations
Description: The cyber security strategy should be aligned the legal and regulatory compliance requirements of the Member Organization.

Name: Cyber Security Strategy - Alignment with banking strategy
Description: The cyber security strategy should be aligned the Banking Sectors cyber security strategy.

Name: Cyber Security Strategy - Address benefits of cyber security
Description: The cyber security strategy should address the importance and benefits of cyber security for the Member Organization.

Name: Cyber Security Strategy - Address future state of cyber security
Description: The cyber security strategy should address the anticipated future state of cyber security for the Member Organization to become and remain resilient to (emerging) cyber security threats.

Name: Cyber Security Strategy - Address initiatives & projects
Description: The cyber security strategy should address which and when cyber security initiatives and projects should be executed to achieve the anticipated future state.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Approval & communication
Description: The cyber security policy should be defined, approved and communicated.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Review
Description: The cyber security policy should be reviewed periodically according to a predefined and structured review process.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Input for other policies
Description: The cyber security policy should be considered as input for other corporate policies of the Member Organization (e.g., HR policy, finance policy and IT policy).

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Support by security standards
Description: The cyber security policy should be supported by detailed security standards (e.g., password standard, firewall standard) and procedures.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Based on best practices
Description: The cyber security policy should be based on best practices and (inter)national standards.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Communication to stakeholders
Description: The cyber security policy should be communicated to relevant stakeholders.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Define cyber security
Description: The cyber security policy should include a definition of cyber security.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Cyber security objectives & scope
Description: The cyber security policy should include the Member Organizations overall cyber security objectives and scope.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Board's intent
Description: The cyber security policy should include a statement of the boards intent, supporting the cyber security objectives.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Define responsibilities
Description: The cyber security policy should include a definition of general and specific responsibilities for cyber security.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Reference to cyber security standards
Description: The cyber security policy should include the reference to supporting cyber security standards and procedures.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Cyber security requirements & importance to member organization
Description: The cyber security policy should include cyber security requirements that ensure information is classified in a way that indicates its importance to the Member Organization

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Cyber security requirements in line with risk appetite
Description: The cyber security policy should include cyber security requirements that ensure information is protected in terms of cyber security requirements, in line with the risk appetite.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Information asset owners
Description: The cyber security policy should include cyber security requirements that ensure owners are appointed for all information assets.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Risk assessment for information assets
Description: The cyber security policy should include cyber security requirements that ensure cyber security risk assessments are conducted for information assets.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Cyber security awareness program
Description: The cyber security policy should include cyber security requirements that ensure  relevant stakeholders are made aware of cyber security and their expected behavior (cyber security awareness program).

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Compliance with regulations and contractual requirements
Description: The cyber security policy should include cyber security requirements that ensure compliance with regulatory and contractual obligations are being met.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Reporting of cyber security weaknesses
Description: The cyber security policy should include cyber security requirements that ensure cyber security breaches and suspected cyber security weaknesses are reported.

Name: Cyber Security Policy - Cyber security in business continuity management
Description: The cyber security policy should include cyber security requirements that ensure  cyber security is reflected in business continuity management.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Sufficient Budget
Description: The Board of Directors has the ultimate responsibility for cyber security, including ensuring that sufficient budget for cyber security is allocated.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Cyber security committee charter
Description: The Board of Directors has the ultimate responsibility for cyber security, including approving the cyber security committee charter.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Endorsing cyber security governance
Description: The Board of Directors has the ultimate responsibility for cyber security, including endorsing (after being approved by the cyber security committee) the cyber security governance.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Endorsing cyber security strategy
Description: The Board of Directors has the ultimate responsibility for cyber security, including endorsing (after being approved by the cyber security committee) the the cyber security strategy.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Endorsing cyber security policy
Description: The Board of Directors has the ultimate responsibility for cyber security, including endorsing (after being approved by the cyber security committee) the cyber security policy.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Monitoring & communicating risk appetite
Description: The cyber security committee should be responsible for monitoring, reviewing and communicating the Member Organizations cyber security risk appetite periodically or upon a material change in the risk appetite.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Review cyber security strategy
Description: The cyber security committee should be responsible for reviewing the cyber security strategy to ensure that it supports the Member Organization objectives.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Cyber security governance
Description: The cyber security committee should be responsible for approving, communicating, supporting and monitoring the cyber security governance.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Cyber security strategy
Description: The cyber security committee should be responsible for approving, communicating, supporting and monitoring the cyber security strategy.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Cyber security policy
Description: The cyber security committee should be responsible for approving, communicating, supporting and monitoring the cyber security policy.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Cyber security programs
Description: The cyber security committee should be responsible for approving, communicating, supporting and monitoring cyber security programs (e.g., awareness program, data classification program, data privacy, data leakage prevention, key cyber security improvements).

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Cyber security risk management process
Description: The cyber security committee should be responsible for approving, communicating, supporting and monitoring cyber security risk management process.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Monitoring key risk indicators (KRIs) & key performance indicators (KPIs)
Description: The cyber security committee should be responsible for approving, communicating, supporting and monitoring the key risk indicators (KRIs) and key performance indicators (KPIs) for cyber security.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Ensure processes reflect security requirements
Description: The senior management should be responsible for ensuring that standards, processes and procedures reflect security requirements (if applicable).

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Individual acceptance & compliance
Description: The senior management should be responsible for ensuring that individuals accept and comply with the cyber security policy, supporting standards and procedures when they are issued and updated.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Job descriptions of key positions & cyber security staff
Description: The senior management should be responsible for ensuring that cyber security responsibilities are incorporated in the job descriptions of key positions and cyber security staff.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Maintain cyber security strategy
Description: The CISO should be responsible for developing and maintaining cyber security strategy.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Maintain cyber security policy
Description: The CISO should be responsible for developing and maintaining cyber security policy.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Maintain cyber security architecture
Description: The CISO should be responsible for developing and maintaining cyber security architecture.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Maintain cyber security risk management process
Description: The CISO should be responsible for developing and maintaining cyber security risk management process.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Establish & implement security standards
Description: The CISO should be responsible for ensuring that detailed security standards and procedures are established, approved and implemented.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Deliver risk-based cyber security solutions
Description: The CISO should be responsible for delivering risk-based cyber security solutions that address people, process and technology.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Deliver cyber security solutions
Description: The CISO should be responsible for developing the cyber security staff to deliver cyber security solutions in a business context.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - SOC monitoring
Description: The CISO should be responsible for the cyber security activities across the Member Organization, including monitoring of the cyber security activities (SOC monitoring).

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Security regulations monitoring
Description: The CISO should be responsible for the cyber security activities across the Member Organization, including monitoring of compliance with cyber security regulations, policies, standards and procedures.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Overseeing investigation of cyber security incidents
Description: The CISO should be responsible for the cyber security activities across the Member Organization, including overseeing the investigation of cyber security incidents.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Gathering and analyzing threat intelligence
Description: The CISO should be responsible for the cyber security activities across the Member Organization, including gathering and analyzing threat intelligence from internal and external sources.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Cyber security activities across the organization
Description: The CISO should be responsible for the cyber security activities across the Member Organization, including performing cyber security reviews.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Conduct cyber security risk assessments
Description: The CISO should be responsible for conducting cyber security risk assessments on the Members Organizations information assets.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Perform information and system classifications
Description: The CISO should be responsible for proactively supporting other functions on cyber security, including performing information and system classifications.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Determine cyber security requirements for projects
Description: The CISO should be responsible for proactively supporting other functions on cyber security, including determining cyber security requirements for important projects.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Proactively support other cyber security functions
Description: The CISO should be responsible for proactively supporting other functions on cyber security, including performing cyber security reviews.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Cyber security awareness programs
Description: The CISO should be responsible for defining and conducting the cyber security awareness programs.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Reporting KRIs and KPIs on cyber security strategy
Description: The CISO should be responsible for measuring and reporting the KRIs and KPIs on cyber security strategy.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Reporting KRIs and KPIs on cyber security policy compliance
Description: The CISO should be responsible for measuring and reporting the KRIs and KPIs on cyber security policy compliance.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Reporting KRIs and KPIs on cyber security standards and procedures
Description: The CISO should be responsible for measuring and reporting the KRIs and KPIs on cyber security standards and procedures.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Reporting KRIs and KPIs on cyber security programs
Description: The CISO should be responsible for measuring and reporting the KRIs and KPIs on cyber security programs (e.g., awareness program, data classification program, key cyber security improvements).

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Cyber security audits
Description: The internal audit function should be responsible for performing cyber security audits.

Name: Cyber Security Roles and Responsibilities - Comply with cyber security policy, standards and procedures
Description: All Member Organizations staff should be responsible for complying with cyber security policy, standards and procedures.

Name: Cyber Security in Project Management - Cyber security should integration into project management methodology
Description: Cyber security should be integrated into the Member Organization's project management methodology to ensure that cyber security risks are identified and addressed as part of a project.

Name: Cyber Security in Project Management - Cyber security objectives in project objectives
Description: The Member Organizations project management methodology should ensure that cyber security objectives are included in project objectives.

Name: Cyber Security in Project Management - Cyber security in all phases of the project
Description: The Member Organizations project management methodology should ensure that the cyber security function is part of all phases of the project.

Name: Cyber Security in Project Management - Risk assessment for project
Description: The Member Organizations project management methodology should ensure that a risk assessment is performed at the start of the project to determine the cyber security risks and to ensure that cyber security requirements are addressed either by the existing cyber security controls (based on cyber security standards) or to be developed.

Name: Cyber Security in Project Management - Project-risk register and tracking
Description: The Member Organizations project management methodology should ensure that cyber security risks are registered in the project-risk register and tracked.

Name: Cyber Security in Project Management - Responsibilities for cyber security
Description: The Member Organizations project management methodology should ensure that responsibilities for cyber security are defined and allocated.

Name: Cyber Security in Project Management - Cyber security review
Description: The Member Organizations project management methodology should ensure that a cyber security review is performed by an independent internal or external party.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Define & conduct for positive cyber security culture
Description: The cyber security awareness programs should be defined, approved and conducted to promote cyber security awareness and to create a positive cyber security culture.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Define & conduct for staff
Description: A cyber security awareness program should be defined and conducted for staff of the Member Organization.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Define & conduct for third parties
Description: A cyber security awareness program should be defined and conducted for third parties of the Member Organization.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Define & conduct for customers
Description: A cyber security awareness program should be defined and conducted for customers of the Member Organization.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Target cyber security behaviors
Description: The cyber security awareness program should target cyber security behaviors by tailoring the program to address the different target groups through multiple channels.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Conduct periodically
Description: The activities of the cyber security awareness program should be conducted periodically and throughout the year.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Include explanation of cyber security measures
Description: The cyber security awareness program should at a minimum include an explanation of cyber security measures provided.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Include the roles and responsibilities
Description: The cyber security awareness program should at a minimum include the roles and responsibilities regarding cyber security.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness -  Include on relevant emerging cyber security events and cyber threats
Description: The cyber security awareness program should at a minimum include information on relevant emerging cyber security events and cyber threats (e.g., spear-phishing, whaling).

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Effectiveness of the awareness activities
Description: The cyber security awareness program should be evaluated to measure the effectiveness of the awareness activities.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Evaluation to formulate recommendations for improvement
Description: The cyber security awareness program should be evaluated to formulate recommendations to improve the cyber security awareness program.

Name: Cyber Security Awareness - Customer awareness
Description: Customer awareness should address for both retail and commercial customers and, at a minimum, include a listing of suggested cyber security mechanisms which customers may consider implementing to mitigate their own risk(s).

Name: Cyber Security Training -  Security-related skills training for key roles
Description: Specialist or security-related skills training should be provided to staff in the Member Organizations relevant functional area categories in line with their job descriptions, including key roles within the organization.

Name: Cyber Security Training -  Security-related skills training for cyber security staff
Description: Specialist or security-related skills training should be provided to staff in the Member Organizations relevant functional area categories in line with their job descriptions, including staff of the cyber security function.

Name: Cyber Security Training -  Security-related skills training for staff maintaining information assets
Description: Specialist or security-related skills training should be provided to staff in the Member Organizations relevant functional area categories in line with their job descriptions, including staff involved in developing and (technically) maintaining information assets.

Name: Cyber Security Training -  Security-related skills training for staff  involved in risk assessments
Description: Specialist or security-related skills training should be provided to staff in the Member Organizations relevant functional area categories in line with their job descriptions, including staff involved in risk assessments.

Name: Cyber Security Training - Education to equip staff
Description: Education should be provided in order to equip staff with the skills and required knowledge to securely operate the Member Organizations information assets.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Approve & implement risk management process
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Safeguard information assets
Description: The cyber security risk management process should focus on safeguarding the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information assets.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Alignment with enterprise risk management process
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be aligned with the existing enterprise risk management process

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Document and address risk identification
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be documented and address risk identification.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Document and address risk analysis
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be documented and address risk analysis.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Document and address risk response
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be documented and address risk response.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Document and address risk monitoring and review
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be documented and address risk monitoring and review.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Address business processes
Description: The cyber security risk management process should address the Member Organizations information assets, including (but not limited to) business processes.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Address business applications
Description: The cyber security risk management process should address the Member Organizations information assets, including (but not limited to) business applications.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Address infrastructure components
Description: The cyber security risk management process should address the Member Organizations information assets, including (but not limited to) infrastructure components.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management -  Initiation at an early stage of  project
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be initiated at an early stage of the project.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management -  Initiation prior to critical change
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be initiated prior to critical change.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management -  Initiation when outsourcing is being considered
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be initiated when outsourcing is being considered.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management -  Initiation when launching new products and technologies
Description: The cyber security risk management process should be initiated when launching new products and technologies.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Periodically subject to cyber security risk assessment
Description: Existing information assets should be periodically subject to cyber security risk assessment based on their classification or risk profile.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Involve business owners
Description: The cyber security risk management activities should involve business owners.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Involve IT specialists
Description: The cyber security risk management activities should involve IT specialists.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Involve cyber security specialists
Description: The cyber security risk management activities should involve cyber security specialists.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Involve  key user representatives
Description: The cyber security risk management activities should involve key user representatives.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Report to the relevant business owner
Description: The result of the risk assessment should be reported to the relevant business owner (i.e., risk owner) within the Member Organization.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Accept and endorse the risk assessment results
Description: The relevant business owner (i.e., risk owner) within the Member Organization should accept and endorse the risk assessment results.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Management - Approve risk appetite and risk tolerance
Description: The Member Organizations cyber security risk appetite and risk tolerance should be clearly defined and formally approved.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Identification - Perform risk identification
Description: Cyber security risk identification should be performed.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Identification - Document risks in central register
Description: Identified cyber security risks should be documented (in a central register).

Name: Cyber Security Risk Identification - Address information assets, threats, vulnerabilities and the key existing cyber security controls
Description: Cyber security risk identification should address relevant information assets, threats, vulnerabilities and the key existing cyber security controls

Name: Cyber Security Risk Analysis - Risk analysis based on the likelihood
Description: A cyber security risk analysis should be conducted based on the likelihood that the identified cyber security risks will occur and their resulting impact. To analyze and determine the nature and the level of the identified cyber security risks.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Analysis - Perform risk analysis
Description: A cyber security risk analysis should be performed.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Analysis - Address the level of potential business impact and likelihood
Description: The cyber security risk analysis should address the level of potential business impact and likelihood of cyber security threat events materializing.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Risk treatment (i.e., accepted, avoided, transferred or mitigated)
Description: The cyber security risks of a Member Organization should be treated. To ensure cyber security risks are treated (i.e., accepted, avoided, transferred or mitigated).

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response- Risk treatment as per risk appetite
Description: The relevant determined cyber security risks should be treated according to the Member Organizations risk appetite and cyber security requirements.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Document risk treatment options
Description: Cyber security risk response should ensure that the list of risk treatment options are documented (i.e., accepting, avoiding, transferring or mitigating risks by applying cyber security controls).

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Risk acceptance
Description: Accepting cyber security risks should include the consideration of predefined limits for levels of cyber security risk.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Risk acceptance by approval & signoff within risk appetite
Description: Accepting cyber security risks should include the approval and sign-off by the business owner, ensuring that the accepted cyber security risk is within the risk appetite and is reported to the cyber security committee.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Risk acceptance by approval & signoff as per SAMA regulations
Description: Accepting cyber security risks should include the approval and sign-off by the business owner, ensuring that the accepted cyber security risk does not contradict SAMA regulations.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Risk avoidance
Description: Avoiding cyber security risks should involve a decision by a business owner to cancel or postpone a particular activity or project that introduces an unacceptable cyber security risk.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Risk transfer involving relevant providers
Description: Transferring or sharing the cyber security risks should involve sharing the cyber security risks with relevant (internal or external) providers.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Risk transfer acceptance by receiving providers
Description: Transferring or sharing the cyber security risks should be accepted by the receiving (internal or external) provider(s).

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Risk transfer to lead to actual sharing
Description: Transferring or sharing the cyber security risks should eventually lead to the actual transferring or sharing of the cyber security risk.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Mitigate cyber security risks with cyber security controls
Description: Applying cyber security controls to mitigate cyber security risks should include identifying appropriate cyber security controls.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Mitigate cyber security risks by cost assessment
Description: Applying cyber security controls to mitigate cyber security risks should include evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of the cyber security controls assessing the cost of implementing the cyber security controls.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Mitigate cyber security risks by feasibility assessment
Description: Applying cyber security controls to mitigate cyber security risks should include evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of the cyber security controls assessing the feasibility of implementing the cyber security controls.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Mitigate cyber security risks by reviewing compliance requirements
Description: Applying cyber security controls to mitigate cyber security risks should include evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of the cyber security controls reviewing relevant compliance requirements for the cyber security controls.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Mitigate cyber security risks by selecting cyber security controls
Description: Applying cyber security controls to mitigate cyber security risks should include selecting cyber security controls.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Mitigate cyber security risks by obtaining signoff on residual risk
Description: Applying cyber security controls to mitigate cyber security risks should include identifying, documenting and obtaining sign-off for any residual risk by the business owner.

Name: Cyber Security Risk Response - Risk treatment plan
Description: Cyber security risk treatment actions should be documented in a risk treatment plan.

Name: Cyber Risk Monitoring and Review - Monitor & tracking progress
Description: The cyber security treatment should be monitored, including tracking progress in accordance to treatment plan.

Name: Cyber Risk Monitoring and Review - Monitor cyber security treatment
Description: The cyber security treatment should be monitored, including the selected and agreed cyber security controls are being implemented.

Name: Cyber Risk Monitoring and Review - Review revised/new controls
Description: The design and effectiveness of the revised or newly implemented cyber security controls should be reviewed.

Name: Cyber Risk Monitoring and Review - Perform process for compliance with regulations
Description: A process should be established for ensuring compliance with relevant regulatory requirements affecting cyber security across the Member Organization. The process of ensuring compliance should be performed periodically or when new regulatory requirements become effective.

Name: Cyber Risk Monitoring and Review - Involve representatives for compliance process
Description: A process should be established for ensuring compliance with relevant regulatory requirements affecting cyber security across the Member Organization. The process of ensuring compliance should involve representatives from key areas of the Member Organization.

Name: Cyber Risk Monitoring and Review - Update policy & procedures
Description: A process should be established for ensuring compliance with relevant regulatory requirements affecting cyber security across the Member Organization. The process of ensuring compliance should result in the update of cyber security policy, standards and procedures to accommodate any necessary changes (if applicable).

Name: Compliance with (inter)national industry standards - Comply with Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS)
Description: The Member Organization should comply with Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS).

Name: Compliance with (inter)national industry standards - Comply with EMV (Europay, MasterCard and Visa) technical standard
Description: The Member Organization should comply with EMV (Europay, MasterCard and Visa) technical standard.

Name: Compliance with (inter)national industry standards - Comply with SWIFT Customer Security Controls Framework  March 2017
Description: The Member Organization should comply with SWIFT Customer Security Controls Framework  March 2017.

Name: Cyber Security Review - Periodic reviews for critical information assets
Description: Cyber security reviews should be periodically performed for critical information assets

Name: Cyber Security Review - Technical test for customer and internet facing services
Description: Customer and internet facing services should be subject to annual review and penetration tests.

Name: Cyber Security Review - Document results of review
Description: Details of cyber security review performed should be recorded, including the results of review, issues identified and recommended actions.

Name: Cyber Security Review - Report review results
Description: The results of cyber security review should be reported to business owner.

Name: Cyber Security Review - Check issues are addressed
Description: Cyber security review should be subject to follow-up reviews to check that all identified issues have been addressed.

Name: Cyber Security Review - Critical risks are treated effectively
Description: Cyber security review should be subject to follow-up reviews to check that critical risks have been treated effectively.

Name: Cyber Security Review - Manage agreed actions
Description: Cyber security review should be subject to follow-up reviews to check that all agreed actions are being managed on an ongoing basis.

Name: Cyber Security Audits - Independent & SAMA compliant
Description: Cyber security audits should be performed independently and according to generally accepted auditing standards and SAMA cyber security framework.

Name: Cyber Security Audits - Audit manual & plan
Description: Cyber security audits should be performed according to the Member Organizations audit manual and audit plan.

Name: Human Resources - Approve & implement
Description: The human resources process should define, approve and implement cyber security requirements.

Name: Human Resources - Monitor & evaluate
Description: The effectiveness of the human resources process should be monitored, measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Human Resources - Staff agreements
Description: The human resource process should include cyber security responsibilities and non-disclosure clauses within staff agreements (during and after the employment);

Name: Human Resources - Cyber security awareness
Description: The human resource process should include staff should receive cyber security awareness at the start and during their employment.

Name: Human Resources - Disciplinary actions
Description: The human resource process should include when disciplinary actions will be applicable.

Name: Human Resources -Screening and background check
Description: The human resource process should include screening and background check.

Name: Human Resources - Post-employment revocation activities
Description: The human resource process should include post-employment cyber security activities, such as revoking access rights.

Name: Human Resources - Post-employment return activities
Description: The human resource process should include post-employment cyber security activities, such as returning information assets assigned (e.g., access badge, tokens, mobile devices, all electronic and physical information).

Name: Physical Security - Approve & implement
Description: The physical security process should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Physical Security - Monitor & evaluate
Description: The effectiveness of the physical security process should be monitored, measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Physical Security - Physical entry controls
Description: The physical security process should include (but not limited to) physical entry controls (including visitor security).

Name: Physical Security - Monitoring and surveillance
Description: The physical security process should include (but not limited to) monitoring and surveillance (e.g., CCTV, ATMs GPS tracking, sensitivity sensors).

Name: Physical Security - Protection of data centers and data rooms.
Description: The physical security process should include (but not limited to) protection of data centers and data rooms.

Name: Physical Security - Environmental protection
Description: The physical security process should include (but not limited to) environmental protection.

Name: Physical Security - Information assets during lifecycle
Description:
The physical security process should include (but not limited to) protection of information assets during lifecycle (including transport and secure disposal, avoiding
unauthorized access and (un)intended data leakage.

Name: Asset Management - Approve & implement
Description: The asset management process should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Asset Management - Monitor & evaluate
Description: The effectiveness of the asset management process should be monitored, measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Asset Management - Unified register
Description: The asset management process should include a unified register.

Name: Asset Management - Asset owner & custodian
Description: The asset management process should include ownership and custodianship of information assets.

Name: Asset Management - Reference to processes
Description: The asset management process should include the reference to relevant other processes, depending on asset management.

Name: Asset Management - Classification, labeling and handling
Description: The asset management process should include information asset classification, labeling and handling.

Name: Asset Management - Discovery of new information assets
Description: The asset management process should include the discovery of new information assets.

Name: Cyber Security Architecture - Approve & implement
Description: The cyber security architecture should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Cyber Security Architecture - Monitor
Description: The compliance with the cyber security architecture should be monitored.

Name: Cyber Security Architecture - Strategic outline
Description: The cyber security architecture should include a strategic outline of cyber security capabilities and controls based on the business requirements.

Name: Cyber Security Architecture - Approve defined architecture
Description: The cyber security architecture should include approval of the defined cyber security architecture.

Name: Cyber Security Architecture - Qualified cyber security architects
Description: The cyber security architecture should include the requirement of having qualified cyber security architects.

Name: Cyber Security Architecture - Design principles for developing cyber security controls
Description: The cyber security architecture should include design principles for developing cyber security controls and applying cyber security requirements (i.e., the security-by-design principle).

Name: Cyber Security Architecture - Periodic review
Description: The cyber security architecture should include periodic review of the cyber security architecture.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Policy
Description: The identity and access management policy, including the responsibilities and accountabilities, should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Monitor compliance
Description: The compliance with the identity and access policy should be monitored.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the cyber security controls within the identity and access management policy should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Business requirements for access control
Description: The identity and access management policy should include business requirements for access control (i.e., need-to-have and need-to-know).

Name: Identity and Access Management - User access management with user types
Description: The identity and access management policy should include user access management (e.g., joiners, movers, leavers) all identified user types should be covered (i.e., internal staff, third parties).

Name: Identity and Access Management - User access management with  changes in job status
Description: The identity and access management policy should include user access management (e.g., joiners, movers, leavers) changes of job status or job positions for internal staff (e.g. joiner, mover and leaver) should be instigated by the human resources department.

Name: Identity and Access Management - User access management with changes for external staff
Description: The identity and access management policy should include user access management (e.g., joiners, movers, leavers) changes for external staff or third parties should be instigated by the appointed accountable party.

Name: Identity and Access Management - User access management with approvals
Description: The identity and access management policy should include user access management (e.g., joiners, movers, leavers) user access requests are formally approved in accordance with business and compliance requirements (i.e., need-to-have and need-to-know to avoid unauthorized access and (un)intended data leakage)).

Name: Identity and Access Management - User access management with access rights
Description: The identity and access management policy should include user access management (e.g., joiners, movers, leavers) changes in access rights should be processed in a timely manner.

Name: Identity and Access Management - User access management with review
Description: The identity and access management policy should include user access management (e.g., joiners, movers, leavers) periodically user access rights and profiles should be reviewed.

Name: Identity and Access Management - User access management with audit trail
Description: The identity and access management policy should include user access management (e.g., joiners, movers, leavers) an audit trail of submitted, approved and processed user access requests and revocation requests should be established.

Name: Identity and Access Management - User access management with automation
Description: The identity and access management policy should include user access management should be supported by automation.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Centralization of function
Description: The identity and access management policy should include centralization of the identity and access management function.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Multi-factor authentication for critical systems
Description: The identity and access management policy should include multi-factor authentication for sensitive and critical systems and profiles.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Privileged and remote access management & multi-factor authentication for all remote access
Description: The identity and access management policy should include privileged and remote access management, which should address the allocation and restricted use of privileged and remote access, specifying multi-factor authentication should be used for all remote access.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Privileged and remote access management based on risk assessment
Description: The identity and access management policy should include privileged and remote access management, which should address the allocation and restricted use of privileged and remote access, specifying multi-factor authentication should be used for privilege access on critical systems based on a risk assessment.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Privileged and remote access management based on periodic review
Description: The identity and access management policy should include privileged and remote access management, which should address the periodic review of users with privileged and remote accounts.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Privileged and remote access management based on individual accountability
Description: The identity and access management policy should include privileged and remote access management, which should address individual accountability.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Privileged and remote access management based usage of non-personal privileged accounts & monitoring
Description: The identity and access management policy should include privileged and remote access management, which should address the use of non-personal privileged accounts, including limitation and monitoring.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Privileged and remote access management based usage of non-personal privileged accounts & passwords
Description: The identity and access management policy should include privileged and remote access management, which should address the use of non-personal privileged accounts, including confidentiality of passwords.

Name: Identity and Access Management - Privileged and remote access management based on periodic review
Description: The identity and access management policy should include privileged and remote access management, which should address the use of non-personal privileged accounts, including changing passwords frequently and at the end of each session.

Name: Application Security - Approve & implement
Description: The application cyber security standards should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Application Security - Compliance monitoring
Description: The compliance with the application security standards should be monitored.

Name: Application Security - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the application cyber security controls should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Application Security - Secure system development life cycle methodology (SDLC)
Description: Application development should follow the approved secure system development life cycle methodology (SDLC).

Name: Application Security - Secure coding standards
Description: The application security standard should include secure coding standards.

Name: Application Security - Implement cyber security controls
Description: The application security standard should include the cyber security controls implemented (e.g., configuration parameters, events to monitor and  retain [including system access and data], identity and access management).

Name: Application Security - Segregation of duties
Description: The application security standard should include the segregation of duties within the application (supported with a documented authorization matrix).

Name: Application Security - Protection of data
Description: The application security standard should include the protection of data aligned with the (agreed) classification scheme (including privacy of customer data and, avoiding unauthorized access and (un)intended data leakage).

Name: Application Security - Vulnerability and patch management
Description: The application security standard should include vulnerability and patch management.

Name: Application Security - Back-up and recovery procedures
Description: The application security standard should include back-up and recovery procedures.

Name: Application Security - Cyber security compliance review
Description: The application security standard should include periodic cyber security compliance review.

Name: Change Management - Approve & implement
Description: The change management process should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Change Management - Compliance monitoring
Description: The compliance with the change management process should be monitored.

Name: Change Management - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the cyber security controls within the change management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Change Management - Cyber security requirements
Description:
The change management process should include cyber security requirements for controlling changes to information assets, such as assessing the
impact of requested changes, classification of changes and the review of changes.

Name: Change Management - Penetration testing
Description: The change management process should include security testing, which should (if applicable) include penetration testing.

Name: Change Management - Source code review (Internal)
Description: The change management process should include security testing, which should (if applicable) include code review if applications are developed internally.

Name: Change Management - Source code review (External)
Description: The change management process should include security testing, which should (if applicable) include code review of externally developed applications and if the source code is available.

Name: Change Management - Source code review report
Description: The change management process should include security testing, which should (if applicable) include a code review report (or equivalent, such as an independent assurance statement) in case the source code cannot be provided.

Name: Change Management - Approval by business owner
Description: The change management process should include approval of changes by the business owner.

Name: Change Management - Approval by cyber security function
Description: The change management process should include approval from the cyber security function before submitting to Change Advisory Board (CAB).

Name: Change Management - Approval by Change Advisory Board (CAB)
Description: The change management process should include approval by Change Advisory Board (CAB).

Name: Change Management - Post-implementation review
Description: The change management process should include post-implementation review of the related cyber security controls.

Name: Change Management - Segregation of environments
Description: The change management process should include development, testing and implementation are segregated for both the (technical) environment and involved individuals.

Name: Change Management - Emergency changes and fixes
Description: The change management process should include the procedure for emergency changes and fixes.

Name: Change Management - Fall-back and roll-back procedures
Description: The change management process should include fall-back and roll-back procedures.

Name: Infrastructure Security - Approve & implement
Description: The infrastructure security standards should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Infrastructure Security - Compliance monitoring
Description: The compliance with the infrastructure security standards should be monitored.

Name: Infrastructure Security - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the infrastructure cyber security controls should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Infrastructure Security - Cover all instances of infrastructure in primary & secondary sites
Description: The infrastructure security standards should cover all instances of infrastructure available in the main datacenter(s), the disaster recovery data site(s) and office spaces.

Name: Infrastructure Security - Cover all instances of infrastructure for all devices
Description: The infrastructure security standards should cover all instances of infrastructure (e.g., operating systems, servers, virtual machines, firewalls, network devices, IDS, IPS, wireless network, gateway servers, proxy servers, email gateways, external connections, databases, file-shares, workstations, laptops, tablets, mobile devices, PBX).

Name: Infrastructure Security - Implemented cyber security controls
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include the cyber security controls implemented (e.g., configuration parameters, events to monitor and retain [including system access and data], data-leakage prevention [DLP], identity and access management, remote maintenance).

Name: Infrastructure Security - Segregation of duties
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include the segregation of duties within the infrastructure component (supported with a documented authorization matrix).

Name: Infrastructure Security - Protection of data
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include the protection of data aligned with the (agreed) classification scheme (including privacy of customer data and, avoiding unauthorized access and (un)intended data leakage).

Name: Infrastructure Security - Approved software and secure protocols.
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include the use of approved software and secure protocols.

Name: Infrastructure Security - Segmentation of networks
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include segmentation of networks.

Name: Infrastructure Security - Malicious code/software and virus protection
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include malicious code/software and virus protection (and applying application whitelisting and APT protection).

Name: Infrastructure Security - Vulnerability and patch management
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include vulnerability and patch management.

Name: Infrastructure Security - DDOS protection including scrubbing services
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include DDOS protection (where applicable); this should include the use of scrubbing services.

Name: Infrastructure Security - DDOS protection including specification of the bandwidth agreed
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include DDOS protection (where applicable); this should include specification of the bandwidth agreed.

Name: Infrastructure Security - DDOS protection including Security Operating Center (SOC), Service Provider (SP) and scrubbing provider
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include DDOS protection (where applicable); this should include 24x7 monitoring by Security Operating Center (SOC), Service Provider (SP) and scrubbing provider.

Name: Infrastructure Security - DDOS protection including DDOS scrubbing
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include DDOS protection (where applicable); this should include testing of DDOS scrubbing (minimum twice a year).

Name: Infrastructure Security - DDOS protection including DDOS services
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include DDOS protection (where applicable); this should include DDOS services should be implemented for the main datacenter(s) as well as the disaster recovery site(s).

Name: Infrastructure Security - Back-up and recovery procedures
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include back-up and recovery procedures.

Name: Infrastructure Security - Periodic compliance review
Description: The infrastructure security standard should include periodic cyber security compliance review.

Name: Cryptography - Approve & implement
Description: A cryptographic security standard should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Cryptography - Compliance monitoring
Description: The compliance with the cryptographic security standard should be monitored.

Name: Cryptography - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the cryptographic security controls should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Cryptography - Cryptographic solutions and relevant restrictions
Description: The cryptographic security standard should include an overview of the approved cryptographic solutions and relevant restrictions (e.g., technically, legally).

Name: Cryptography - Approved cryptographic solutions
Description: The cryptographic security standard should include the circumstances when the approved cryptographic solutions should be applied.

Name: Cryptography - Encryption keys
Description: The cryptographic security standard should include the management of encryption keys, including lifecycle management, archiving and recovery.

Name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) - Approve & implement
Description: The BYOD cyber security standard should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) - Compliance monitoring
Description: The compliance with the BYOD cyber security standard should be monitored.

Name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the BYOD cyber security controls should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) - Responsibilities of the user
Description: The BYOD standard should include responsibilities of the user (including awareness training).

Name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) - Restrictions on personal devices
Description: The BYOD standard should include information regarding the restrictions and consequences for staff when the Member Organization implements cyber security controls on their personal devices; for example when using modified devices (jailbreaking), terminating the employment or in case of loss or theft of the personal device.

Name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) -  isolation from personal data
Description: The BYOD standard should include the isolation of business information from personal information (e.g., containerization).

Name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) - Regulation of corporate mobile applications
Description: The BYOD standard should include the regulation of corporate mobile applications or approved public mobile applications.

Name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) - Mobile device management (MDM)
Description: The BYOD standard should include the use of mobile device management (MDM); applying access controls to the device and business container and encryption mechanisms on the personal device (to ensure secure transmission and storage).

Name: Secure Disposal of Information Assets - Approve & implement
Description: The secure disposal standard and procedure should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Secure Disposal of Information Assets - Compliance monitoring
Description: The compliance with the secure disposal standard and procedure should be monitored.

Name: Secure Disposal of Information Assets - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the secure disposal cyber security controls should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Secure Disposal of Information Assets - Disposal as per laws & regulations
Description: Information assets should be disposed in accordance with legal and regulatory requirements, when no longer required (i.e. meeting data privacy regulations to avoid unauthorized access and avoid (un)intended data leakage).

Name: Secure Disposal of Information Assets - Non-retrievable destruction
Description: Sensitive information should be destroyed using techniques to make the information non-retrievable (e.g., secure erase, secure wiping, incineration, double crosscut, shredding).

Name: Secure Disposal of Information Assets - Evaluation
Description: The Member Organization should ensure that third party service providers used for secure disposal, transport and storage comply with the secure disposal standard and procedure and the effectiveness is periodically measured and evaluated.

Name: Payment Systems - SARIE Information Security Policy
Description: For Saudi Arabian Riyal Interbank Express (SARIE) information, the Member Organization must follow SARIE Information Security Policy, Version Issue 1.0 - June 2016.

Name: Payment Systems - Mada Rules and Standards Technical Book Part IIIa
Description: For mada information, the Member Organization shall follow the sections in the mada Rules and Standards Technical Book Part IIIa - Security Framework, Version Issue 6.0.0 - May 2016.

Name: Payment Systems - Mada Rules and Standards Technical Book Part IIIb - HSM Requirements
Description: For mada information, the Member Organization shall follow the sections in the mada Rules and Standards Technical Book Part IIIb - HSM Requirements, Version Issue 6.0.0 - May 2016.

Name: Payment Systems -  Mada Rules and Standards Technical Book SAMA CA IPK
Description: For mada information, the Member Organization shall follow the sections in the mada Rules and Standards Technical Book SAMA CA IPK Certificate Procedures, Version Issue 6.0.1  October 2016.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Approve & implement
Description: The cyber security standards for electronic banking services should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Compliance monitoring
Description: The compliance with cyber security standards for electronic banking services should be monitored.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the cyber security standard for electronic banking services should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Brand protection
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover use of brand protection measures to protect online services including social media.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of official application stores and websites
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of official application stores and websites (applicable for online and mobile banking).

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of detection measures and take-down of malicious apps and websites
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of detection measures and take-down of malicious apps and websites (applicable for online and mobile banking);

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of sandboxing
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of sandboxing (applicable for online and mobile banking).

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of non-caching techniques
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of non-caching techniques (applicable for online and mobile banking).

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of communication techniques  to avoid man-in-the-middle-attacks
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of communication techniques to avoid man-in-the-middle-attacks (applicable for online and mobile banking).

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of multi-factor authentication for registration
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms multi-factor authentication should be used during the registration process for the customer in order to use of electronic banking services.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of multi-factor authentication for all banking services
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms multi-factor authentication should be implemented for all electronic banking services available to customers.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of multi-factor authentication involving hard & soft tokens
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms the use of hard and soft tokens should be password protected.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Incorrect passwords or invalid PINs
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms revoking the access of customers after 3 successive incorrect passwords or invalid PINs.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of multi-factor authentication for changing customer mobile number
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms the process for changing the customer mobile number should only be done from either a branch or ATM.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Activating of the multi-factor authentication
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms the processes for requesting and activating of the multi-factor authentication should be done through different delivery channels.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Multi-factor authentication for sign-on
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms should be implemented for sign-on.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of multi-factor authentication for adding or modifying beneficiaries
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms should be implemented for adding or modifying beneficiaries.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of multi-factor authentication for adding utility and government payment services.
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms should be implemented for adding utility and government payment services.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of multi-factor authentication for high-risk transactions
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms should be implemented for high-risk transactions (when it exceeds predefined limits).

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Use of multi-factor authentication for password reset
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover online, mobile and phone banking use of multi-factor authentication mechanisms should be implemented for password reset.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Adding and activating beneficiaries
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover should cover the processes for adding and activating beneficiaries should be done through different delivery channels (applicable for mobile and online banking).

Name: Electronic Banking Services - High availability of the electronic banking services
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover high availability of the electronic banking services should be ensured.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Scheduled downtime
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover scheduled downtime of the electronic banking services and should be timely communicated to SAMA and customers.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Contractual agreements with customer
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover contractual agreements between the Member Organization and the customer addressing the roles, responsibilities and liabilities for both the Member Organization and the customers.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Approval of SAMA
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover obtaining approval of SAMA before launching a new electronic banking service.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Exploiting the ATM/POS application
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover prevention and detection of exploiting the ATM/POS application and infrastructure vulnerabilities (e.g., cables, (USB)-ports, rebooting).

Name: Electronic Banking Services - hardening of systems & security controls
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover cyber security measures, such as hardening of operating systems, malware protection, privacy screens, masking of passwords or account numbers (e.g., screen and receipt), geo-blocking (e.g., disable cards per default for outside GCC countries, disable magnetic strip transactions), video monitoring (CCTV), revoking cards after 3 successive invalid PINs, anti-skimming solutions (hardware/software), and PIN-pad protection.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - Remote stopping of ATMs
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover remote stopping of ATMs in case of malicious activities.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - SMS instant notification with no sensitive data
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover SMS instant notification services including SMS instant notification services and SMS messages should not contain sensitive data (e.g., account balance - except for credit cards).

Name: Electronic Banking Services - SMS instant notification to both numbers
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover SMS instant notification services including SMS alert which should be sent to both mobile numbers (old and new) when the customers mobile number has been changed.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - SMS instant notification to both numbers for multi-factor authentication
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover SMS instant notification services including SMS notification should be sent to the customers mobile number when requesting a new multi-factor authentication mechanism.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - SMS instant notification for retail and personal financial transactions
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover SMS instant notification services including SMS notification should be sent to the customers mobile number for all retail and personal financial transactions.

Name: Electronic Banking Services - SMS instant notification for beneficiary updates
Description: Electronic banking services security standard should cover SMS instant notification services including SMS notification should be sent to the customers mobile number when beneficiaries are added, modified and activated.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Approve & implement
Description: The security event management process should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the cyber security controls within the security event management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Security event monitoring
Description: To support this process a security event monitoring standard should be defined, approved and implemented. The standard should address for all information assets the mandatory events which should be monitored, based on the classification or risk profile of the information asset.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Security event management process
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for the establishment of a designated team responsible for security monitoring (i.e., Security Operations Center (SOC)).

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Skilled and trained staff
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for skilled and (continuously) trained staff.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - SOC activities and workspaces
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for a restricted area to facilitate SOC activities and workspaces.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Continuous security event monitoring activities
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for resources required continuous security event monitoring activities (24x7).

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Detection and handling of malicious code
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for detection and handling of malicious code and software.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Detection and handling of security or suspicious events
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for detection and handling of security or suspicious events and anomalies.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Deployment of security network packet analysis solution
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for deployment of security network packet analysis solution.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Protection of logs
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for adequately protected logs.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Compliance monitoring of applications and infrastructure
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for periodic compliance monitoring of applications and infrastructure cyber security standards.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for automated and centralized analysis of security loggings and correlation of event or patterns (i.e., Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)).

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Reporting of cyber security incidents
Description: The security event management process should include requirements for reporting of cyber security incidents.

Name: Cyber Security Event Management - Periodic testing
Description: The security event management process should include independent periodic testing of the effectiveness of the security operations center (e.g., redteaming).

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Alignment with incident management process
Description: The cyber security incident management process should be defined, approved, implemented and aligned with the enterprise incident management process.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Measure & evaluate
Description: The effectiveness of the cyber security controls within the cyber security incident management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Mandatory and suspicious security events
Description: The standard should address the mandatory and suspicious security events which should be responded to.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Designated team
Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for the establishment of a designated team responsible for security incident management.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Skilled and (continuously) trained staff
