Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for skilled and (continuously) trained staff.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Certified forensic staff
Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for sufficient capacity available of certified forensic staff for handling major incidents (e.g., internal staff or contracting an external forensic team).

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Computer emergency response team (CERT) workspaces
Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for a restricted area to facilitate the computer emergency response team (CERT) workspaces.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Classification of incidents
Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for the classification of cyber security incidents.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Timely handling of incidents
Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for the timely handling of cyber security incidents, recording and monitoring progress.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Protection of relevant evidence and loggings
Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for the protection of relevant evidence and loggings.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Post-incident activities
Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for post-incident activities, such as forensics, root-cause analysis of the incidents.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Suggested improvements
Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for reporting of suggested improvements to the CISO and the Committee.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Establish a cyber security incident repository
Description: The security incident management process should include requirements for establishing a cyber security incident repository.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - SAMA IT Risk Supervision
Description: The Member Organization should inform SAMA IT Risk Supervision immediately when a medium or high classified security incident has occurred and identified.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - no objection from SAMA IT Risk Supervision
Description: The Member Organization should obtain no objection from SAMA IT Risk Supervision before any media interaction related to the incident.

Name: Cyber Security Incident Management - Formal incident report
Threat Management - Approve & implement
Description: The threat intelligence management process should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Threat Management - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the threat intelligence management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Threat Management - Threat intelligence management process (internal sources)
Description: The threat intelligence management process should include the use of internal sources, such as access control, application and infrastructure logs, IDS, IPS, security tooling, Security Information and Event Monitoring (SIEM), support functions (e.g., Legal, Audit, IT Helpdesk, Forensics, Fraud Management, Risk Management, Compliance).

Name: Threat Management - Threat intelligence management process (external sources)
Description: The threat intelligence management process should include the use of reliable and relevant external sources, such as SAMA, government agencies, security forums, (security) vendors, security organizations and specialist notification services.

Name: Threat Management - Methodology to analyze
Description: The threat intelligence management process should include a defined methodology to analyze the threat information periodically.

Name: Threat Management -  Identified or collected threats
Description: The threat intelligence management process should include the relevant details on identified or collected threats, such as modus operandi, actors, motivation and type of threats.

Name: Threat Management - Derived intelligence
Description: The threat intelligence management process should include the relevance of the derived intelligence and the action-ability for follow-up (for e.g., SOC, Risk Management).

Name: Threat Management - Relevant intelligence
Description: The threat intelligence management process should include sharing the relevant intelligence with the relevant stakeholders (e.g., SAMA, BCIS members).

Name: Vulnerability Management - Approve & implement
Description: The vulnerability management process should be defined, approved and implemented.

Name: Vulnerability Management - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the vulnerability management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Vulnerability Management - All information assets
Description: The vulnerability management process should include all information assets.

Name: Vulnerability Management - Frequency of scan
Description: The vulnerability management process should include frequency of performing the vulnerability scan (risk-based).

Name: Vulnerability Management - Classification of vulnerabilities
Description: The vulnerability management process should include classification of vulnerabilities.

Name: Vulnerability Management - Timelines to mitigate
Description: The vulnerability management process should include defined timelines to mitigate (per classification).

Name: Vulnerability Management - Prioritization for classified information assets
Description: The vulnerability management process should include prioritization for classified information assets.

Name: Vulnerability Management - Patch management and method of deployment
Description: The vulnerability management process should include patch management and method of deployment.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Approve & implement
Description: The cyber security requirements should be defined, approved, implemented and communicated within the contract and vendor management processes.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Compliance monitoring
Description: The compliance with contract and vendor management process should be monitored.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The effectiveness of the cyber security controls within the contract and vendor management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Requirement of cyber security function
Description: These contract and vendor management processes should cover whether the involvement of the cyber security function is actively required (e.g., in case of due diligence).

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Baseline cyber security requirements
Description: These contract and vendor management processes should cover the baseline cyber security requirements which should be applied in all cases.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Cyber security reviews and audits
Description: These contract and vendor management processes should cover the right to periodically perform cyber security reviews and audits.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Cyber security risk assessment
Description: The contract management process should cover requirements for executing a cyber security risk assessment as part of the procurement process.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Cyber requirements in tender process
Description: The contract management process should cover requirements for defining the specific cyber security requirements as part of the tender process.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Evaluating the replies of potential vendors
Description: The contract management process should cover requirements for evaluating the replies of potential vendors on the defined cyber security requirements.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Testing of the agreed cyber security requirements
Description: The contract management process should cover requirements for testing of the agreed cyber security requirements (risk-based).

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Communication or escalation process for incidents
Description: The contract management process should cover requirements for defining the communication or escalation process in case of cyber security incidents.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Exiting, terminating or renewing the contract
Description: The contract management process should cover requirements for ensuring cybersecurity requirements are defined for exiting, terminating or renewing the contract (including escrow agreements if applicable).

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Mutual confidentiality agreement
Description: The contract management process should cover requirements for defining a mutual confidentiality agreement.

Name: Contract and Vendor Management - Vendor management process
Description: The vendor management process (i.e., service level management) should cover requirements for periodic reporting, reviewing and evaluating the contractually agreed cybersecurity requirements (in SLAs).

Name: Outsourcing - Approve & implement outsourcing policy and process
Description: The cyber security requirements within the outsourcing policy and process should be defined, approved, implemented and communicated within Member Organization.

Name: Outsourcing - Effectiveness measurement
Description: The cyber security requirements regarding the outsourcing policy and process should be measured and periodically evaluated.

Name: Outsourcing - Approval from SAMA
Description: The outsourcing process should include the approval from SAMA prior to material outsourcing.

Name: Outsourcing - Involvement of the cyber security function
Description: The outsourcing process should include the involvement of the cyber security function.

Name: Outsourcing - SAMA circular on outsourcing
Description: The outsourcing process should include compliance with the SAMA circular on outsourcing.

Name: Cloud Computing - Approve cloud computing policy
Description: The cyber security controls within the cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should be defined, approved and implemented and communicated within Member Organization.

Name: Cloud Computing - Monitor cloud computing policy
Description: The compliance with the cloud computing policy should be monitored.

Name: Cloud Computing - Evaluate controls for cloud computing policy
Description: The cyber security controls regarding the cloud computing policy and process for hybrid and public cloud services should be periodically measured and evaluated.

Name: Cloud Computing - Cyber security risk assessment and due diligence on the cloud service provider
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for the process for adopting cloud services, including a cyber security risk assessment and due diligence on the cloud service provider and its cloud services should be performed.

Name: Cloud Computing - SAMA approval for using cloud services
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for the process for adopting cloud services, the Member Organization should obtain SAMA approval prior to using cloud services or signing the contract with the cloud provider.

Name: Cloud Computing - Contract with cloud service provider
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for the process for adopting cloud services, a contract should be in place, including the cyber security requirements, before using cloud services.

Name: Cloud Computing - Cloud data location
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for data location, in principle only cloud services should be used that are located in Saudi Arabia, or when cloud services are to be used outside Saudi Arabia that the Member Organization should obtain explicit approval from SAMA.

Name: Cloud Computing - Data use limitations
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for data use limitations, the cloud service provider should not use the Member Organizations data for secondary purposes.

Name: Cloud Computing - Risk assessment
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for security, the cloud service provider should implement and monitor the cyber security controls as determined in the risk assessment for protecting the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the Member Organizations data.

Name: Cloud Computing - Logical segregation of data
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for data segregation, the Member Organizations data is logically segregated from other data held by the cloud service provider, including that the cloud service provider should be able to identify the Member Organizations data and at all times should be able to distinguish it from other data.

Name: Cloud Computing - Business continuity requirements
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for business continuity, business continuity requirements are met in accordance with the Member Organizations business continuity policy.

Name: Cloud Computing - Cyber security review at the cloud service provider
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for audit, review and monitoring, the Member Organization has the right to perform a cyber security review at the cloud service provider.

Name: Cloud Computing - Cyber security audit at the cloud service provider
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for audit, review and monitoring, the Member Organization has the right to perform a cyber security audit at the cloud service provider.

Name: Cloud Computing - Cyber security examination at the cloud service provider
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for audit, review and monitoring, the Member Organization has the right to perform a cyber security examination at the cloud service provider.

Name: Cloud Computing - Termination rights
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for exit, the Member Organization has termination rights.

Name: Cloud Computing - Return data on termination
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for exit, the cloud service provider has to return the Member Organizations data on termination.

Name: Cloud Computing -  Irreversibly delete data on termination
Description: The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for exit, the cloud service provider has to irreversibly delete the Member Organizations data on termination.
